text: Prestige classes allow characters to become truly exceptional, gaining powers beyond the ken of their peers. Unlike the core classes, characters must meet specific requirements before they can take their first level of a prestige class. If a character does not meet the requirements for a prestige class before gaining any benefits of that level, that character cannot take that prestige class. Characters that take levels in prestige classes do not gain any favored class bonuses for those levels.

sections.text: An arcane spellcaster who draws upon ancient elven traditions to infuse his arrows with potent magical power.
sections.name: Arcane Archer

sections.text: A troublemaker and a scoundrel who uses arcane magic to enhance her thievery and trickery.
sections.name: Arcane Trickster

sections.text: A remorseless murderer who kills for money and the sheer thrill of death-dealing.
sections.name: Assassin

sections.text: An arcane spellcaster who has embraced his latent draconic heritage and, over the course of training and devotion, undergoes a partial transformation into a dragon.
sections.name: Dragon Disciple

sections.text: A swashbuckling swordfighter who relies upon grace, poise, and acrobatics to win the day.
sections.name: Duelist

sections.text: An arcane spellcaster who augments his magical skills with combat to create a deadly combination of weapons and magic.
sections.name: Eldritch Knight

sections.text: A spellcaster who devotes his life to research and rumination upon the mysteries of the world.
sections.name: Loremaster

sections.text: Equally devoted to divine and arcane magic, the mystic theurge combines both magical traditions into one incredibly diverse class.
sections.name: Mystic Theurge

sections.text: An explorer at heart, the Pathfinder chronicler travels to distant, exotic lands to expand her knowledge of the world.
sections.name: Pathfinder Chronicler

sections.text: A mysterious adventurer who walks the boundaries between the real world and the realm of shadows, and who can command shadows to do her bidding.
sections.name: Shadowdancer

sections.text: Here are definitions of some terms used in this section.
sections.name: Definitions of Terms

sections.text: One of the standard eleven classes found in Classes.
sections.name: Core Class

sections.text: Generally equal to the number of class levels (see below) in a spellcasting class. Some prestige classes add caster levels to an existing class.
sections.name: Caster Level

sections.text: The total level of the character, which is the sum of all class levels held by that character.
sections.name: Character Level

sections.text: The level of a character in a particular class. For a character with levels in only one class, class level and character level are the same.
sections.name: Class Level
